1: <sup>1</sup> Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?
2: <sup>2</sup> The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
3: <sup>3</sup> For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.
4: <sup>4</sup> The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
5: <sup>5</sup> His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
6: <sup>6</sup> He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.
7: <sup>7</sup> His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
8: <sup>8</sup> He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
9: <sup>9</sup> He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
10: <sup>10</sup> He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
11: <sup>11</sup> He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.
12: <sup>12</sup> Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
13: <sup>13</sup> Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.
14: <sup>14</sup> Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
15: <sup>15</sup> Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.
16: <sup>16</sup> The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.
17: <sup>17</sup> LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
18: <sup>18</sup> To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
